thread.title: Burnt Hills field hockey blanks Guilderland
thread.title_full: Burnt Hills field hockey blanks Guilderland - Times Union

author: Staff reports
title: Burnt Hills field hockey blanks Guilderland
text:
Burnt Hills climbed to 10-0 in the Suburban Council with a 4-0 win over host Guilderland on Friday in a Suburban Council field hockey clash.
Senior goalie Brittney Ryan stopped four shots to record her fifth shutout of the season and senior Elise Zwicklbauer scored two goals to lead Burnt Hills, which moved to 11-1 overall. Lexie Ball chipped in with two assists for the Spartans.
Guilderland dropped to 5-3 with the loss.
More field hockey: Ali Shumsky snapped a scoreless tie with 3 minutes, 59 seconds remaining in the first overtime period to lift Taconic Hills over Pine Plains, 1-0, in a nonleague matchup. Keeper Hannah Waldorf stopped nine shots to earn the shutout for Taconic Hills, which improved to 6-4. ... Bethlehem topped Guilderland 1-0 on a goal by Megan Guiry .
Boys' volleyball: Burnt Hills swept Colonie, 3-0, in a Suburban Council match. Cody Pearce had 13 assists, nine kills and five aces for the Spartans, who upped their record to 11-3 overall and 9-1 in the league. Brad Albright had 11 kills and Ben Pelton added 15 assists for Burnt Hills, which won by scores of 25-19, 25-10 and 25-9. ... Nick Mazone had nine kills and Andrew Wollner added eight digs to lead Bethlehem to a four-set win over Shenendehowa (25-21, 24-26, 25-20, 25-23). Mitchell DeBartoli had 13 kills and four blocks and Sean Dillon added 11 kills for the Plainsmen.
Girls' soccer: Abby O'Connor scored two goals as Scotia (11-0, 8-0) topped Gloversville, 3-1.
Boys' soccer: Thomas Seeberger had four goals and an assist for Loudonville Christian as the Eagles topped Germantown, 7-1, in a Western Athletic Conference game. ... Jonny Hacker touched in the game winner on a cross from Poe Thar with 10 minutes left in the game to spark Doane Stuart over Berlin, 1-0, in a Central Hudson Valley League game.
